Aguardo um retorno.
creator: dri.boaventura

title: e-mail doesn't display in containing folder
content:
Hello. I was searching my Inbox for e-mails I knew I had, but they weren't showing up! After doing a general search, I found the e-mails in the search results. Then, I clicked "open in conversation" and they were all there and labeled with "Inbox" or "Sent" folder, respectively. So I right-clicked and selected, "open in containing folder", but it didn't work! The "containing folder" opened [i.e., the Inbox], but didn't show the e-mail! So then I searched manually by scrolling in the Inbox to the date of the "hidden" e-mail -- yet it wasn't there!

(In other words, when I did "open in conversation" from the search results, it showed the conversation, but I can't actually see the e-mails in their containing folder!) Besides for this problem, but I think there are a lot of other e-mails that are "hiding" in this way as well. What should I do?

Thanks for any help you can provide!

Sincerely, Jonathan Rosenberg
creator: slowtoreply

title: changing accounts erases entered message text
content:
Please look at the included screen shots.

The text is gone!
creator: edsnet555

title: Inconsistent delivery of emails
content:
A neighbour and I both use Thunderbird and are both members of a small residents' committee. I have been sending items out using the Thunderbird account linked to my website. Some have received them (not thunderbird users) but others have not. I can write to everyone using a different (gmail) account which also uses Thunderbird, and everyone gets them. The neighbour likewise can write to me direct from her gmail account (ie not using Thunderbird) but not from her main account using Thunderbird. 

I checked on recent updates and restarted the laptop but that made no difference.

That all sounds very confusing and yes I am confused and would welcome some simple advice (I am not an expert!)on where we start to track this down. I suspect we're missing something simple. I hope so! Many thanks Paul
creator: countrycasita

title: Rebuilding Thunderbird without my old profile
content:
My computer of the last few years crashed and will not reboot. I did not manage to copy over my old Thunderbird profile info, so that is now lost.

However, I do have my old pop3 email folders saved in a folder with my other document files.

I'd like to rebuild my Thunderbird email account so I can access all the emails saved in my email folders but am not sure how to go about doing that without my other profile info.

Is this possible? How would I do it?

Huge thanks for any help you can provide.

Greg
creator: gregoryspatz

title: 'Automatically mark messages as read' is disabled but is ignored in Archives
content:
Hello,

in Thunderbird 115.7.0 on Ubuntu 22.04 I have the option 'Automatically mark messages as read' disabled. But this setting is ignored for the foldes in Archive and it´s subfolders regardless of the account. That means this options behaves the same for the folder Archives in every account.

Cheers Mark

title: read status in conversations is not translated through

How to fix that?

Thanks. Kind regards, Stefan

title: Opening a saved email is slowly
content: Hi! I noticed this problem in my work environment. Clients TB 115.7 64bit (without addons) Os Win 10 22h2 full updated If I open a mail saved in the network or on the desktop and I open it with thunderbird closed it's open fast as I expect, but If I open it with thunderbird already open it is extremely slow, especially on low budget computers, but this behaviour is noticeable also on high end computers. There are some trick that I can do to avoid this? I've tried also to enable/disable the hardware acceleration if avaiable, without notice any improvement. The only way now to avoid this problem is to open the *.eml with another program if thunderbird is open. Thanks
creator: GIOVANNI.FORLANI

title: TB not opening
content: Win 11. TB updated, uninstalled and reinstalled. Will still not open, sits in tray with wee blue line under, click it and mini version of my accounts sit on top of the tray. Cannot use it. While this goes the BCOD spins on the screen. I can open TB on my wife desktop but not mine. Strangely I have no MS restore points at all.
creator: alangjones

title: Mozilla Thunderbirds- Virgin media (UK)..password did not succeed
content:
Hello I use Thunderbirds on my PC. I use Virgin media (UK) as my provider. Recently Virgin have started to force customers to include/use alternative emails and servers and I now am having to use a G mail email address, in conjunction with my virginmedia address. I'm a little confused by it all.

My current problem is. Mozilla Thunderbirds can send emails, but can't receive them. When I check the virgin website and emails, they are sending and receiving, but they are not arriving at Mozilla Thunderbirds. So the problem is with the settings on Thinderbirds. I think

My error messages are.

"Sending of password for user @~#@virginmedia.com did not succeed. Mail server pop3.virginmedia.com responded: [AUTH] Authentication failed.

I re-enter a password then get

"Login to server pop3.virginmedia.com with username @~#@virginmedia.com failed"

In put please. Robbo
creator: robbo777

title: Thunderbird Problem to open email and download attached file
content:
Hi folks,

after a restoring a backup using this procedure ( https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer ) in a new machine that don't have internet connection, I initially can find and open my old mail when i was offline and download any attached files. Furthermore, the incoming mail view had the same status of mail received at the moment of the backup. Now, after some times, it's not possible to do the same things: 

-i can find all mail and see the body in a search context but when i try to open in a dedicated window, i     obtain a blank window.  -the incoming/send mail view is completely blank, no historization of older receive/sent mail is shown.

This not happens for the mail moved-archived in specific folder different from incoming/sent mail, in that case i can open the email and download the attached files.

I thank you in advance for your help,

C.
creator: cesma2000

title: Email accounts not getting setup on thunderbird

I've tried to setup email account on thunderbird after changing networks, completely uninstalling and reinstalling on my computer and other as well but got same error every time.
